ranked_diseases.explanation: Patient presents with identical phenotypic features (chronic sinusitis, chronic bronchitis, chronic rhinitis, nasal polyposis) to reference cases 1 and 2, both diagnosed with MHC class I deficiency. This immunodeficiency causes recurrent respiratory tract infections.
The combination of chronic sinusitis, bronchitis, rhinitis, and nasal polyposis is classic for ciliary dysfunction, causing impaired mucociliary clearance and chronic respiratory infections.
Can present with chronic sinusitis, nasal polyposis, and chronic bronchitis due to thick mucus secretions, though typically has additional gastrointestinal manifestations not noted here.
CVID can cause recurrent sinopulmonary infections leading to chronic sinusitis and bronchitis, though typically presents with additional infections beyond the respiratory tract.
IgA deficiency predisposes to recurrent respiratory tract infections, potentially leading to chronic sinusitis and bronchitis, though nasal polyposis is less typical.
